channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2023120061
item.description:
Report E-2023120061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: SPRINGDALE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSD experienced a UN3109 Microtox Ultra release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 3’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon vented poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110753
item.description:
Report X-2023110753

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: TEXARKANA
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped while being unloaded causing leak. Package was placed into a lined tote for containment. DescribePack: Metal can was punctured on bottom near edge. 2/3 inch opening. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed into a lined plastic tote and moved aways from spill area.
